text: Mare Vint (born Mare Mänd; 15 September 1942 – 10 May 2020) was an Estonian graphic artist. In her work, Vint mostly depicted an "ideal landscape". == Life == Vint was born in Tallinn, where she graduated from 9th Secondary School in 1961. From 1962 to 1967, she studied at the Estonian SSR State Art Institute; she graduated as a glass artist. From 1967 to 1969, she worked as a High School art teacher in Tallinn, then as a freelance artist. She was a member of the Estonian Artists' Union since 1973. She worked in ink and pencil drawing, and mostly lithography since 1972. In Mare Vint's work of the second half of the 1960s and the beginning of the 1970s, a style emerged, characterized by the black-and-white contrast of the drawings, in which color is more conditional. She was awarded the Order of the White Star IV class, in 2015. == References == category:1942 births category:2020 deaths Category:20th-century women artists Category:Modern painters Category:Estonian women painters Category:Graphic artists Category:20th-century Estonian painters Category:21st-century Estonian painters Category:Estonian Academy of Arts alumni Category:Recipients of the Order of the White Star, 5th Class Category:People from Tallinn
title: Mare Vint
